unit_learning_outcomes.description: Design and critique creative, evidence-based learning experiences that support the reading and writing development of students in the later years of primary school.
Apply knowledge of differentiated literacy instruction to cater for diverse learners.
Develop strategies for and engage in research and reflexive practice to ensure quality student outcomes and nurture evidence-based practice.
Analyse and evaluate Syllabus & research-informed literacy strategies for students from diverse backgrounds in the later years of primary school.
Explain and evaluate the role and value of language, literacy and literature across the curriculum in later primary school (Yr 3 - 6) contexts.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Reading before the lectures and tutorials.

assessments.description: Adaptation of published unit of work.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: EDST8208 - Teaching English in the Primary School 3
data.description: This unit builds on knowledge and skills developed in EDST8206 and EDST8207. It extends students' understanding of teaching principles and strategies for promoting the language and literacy skills of diverse learners across the later primary school years.  The focus of the unit is on reading to learn and composing effective written and multimodal texts for a range of purposes and audiences. The unit will also examine research-informed ways teachers can use oral language interactions and a range of quality everyday and literary texts in their classrooms. The pedagogic emphasis is on a continuous cycle of explicit, systematic, and evidence-based instruction for all students. Collegial, co-operative relationships underpin work in this unit and there is an emphasis on the autonomous learning and reflective capacity needed for continued development as a teacher of English in primary schools.
